explains: n. 州长或总督等的职位；州长或总督等的任期

sentences.en: The governorship went to a Democrat, Mrs. Anne Richards.
sentences.cn: 当选州长的是民主党的安妮·理查兹。

sentences.en: Mr Corzine spent a fortune to win first a Senate seat and then the governorship.
sentences.cn: 科尔津先生花了点钱首先赢得了参议员席位，然后得到州长地位。

sentences.en: Richard Nixon “retired” in 1962 after losing an election for the governorship of California.
sentences.cn: 理查德·尼克松1962年“退休”后，在加利福尼亚州长选举中失败。
